intro: Dipera capensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Dipera capensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
